title: Toxicity
body: Not mad atm but I was thinking most times people are toxic is when someone who was toxic a game before made that player feel sad but also angry which leads to toxicity into the next game and maybe feeding/trolling/instalocking/tilting etc. If maybe people stop getting mad at a bad player and accept for who they are, maybe we could recude toxicity and maybe the community will turn out good. If we spread the message out maybe just maybe, one day everyone will feel positive each game. But ik this is impossible but if you guise could make most players feel welcome, that'll be very appreciated. Your friend Nature {{champion:57}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:30}}

replies.body:
I'm going to get raged at or downvoted or whatever, but i honestly think the biggest problem this server has is **ELO boosting** and **buddy boosting**.. 


a gold/plat or diamond friend jumps on a bronze/silver/gold account and boosts it because his/her friend honestly believes they belong higher than what they are currently ranked.

this generates 2 problems

1. As the booster climbs, he stomps whoever is in his/her path. then when the original owner returns to the account he/she cant actually handle the new higher elo, is unskilled etc.. and drops like a stone. effecting even more players.
 
2. Promotes toxic/raging from his/her team players because of sheer frustration because of point 1



the other problem i see on this server is


everyone wants to be the hero, never the team-player. and most of the time cant work in a team orientated fashion, its pathetic



the mentality I usually see on OCE is:

1. Entitled snotty brat who refuses to listen to anyone even if they are higher ranked. and will rage at those who are lower ranked.
2. Selfish
3. Closed minded
4. Lazy

It doesn't matter if you're bad at playing or just playing bad - you're a burden to 4 other players and if they start falling behind because you're not pulling your weight they're going to start getting fed up. As bad as it sounds, the 'victim' is just as much at fault as the 'bad guy(s)'.

You have a point but instead of being toxic, give them tips or tell them what to do instead of being an ignorant dikwit and start abusing them for being crappy. At that point they'll probs do what I mentioned above (Forgot AFK) and yh.

In my experience unskilled players rage when they get owned, blaming other lanes. They in turn get defensive and it spirals out of control. I think the most important way to battle in game rage is realise no one is responsible for carrying you. You are responsible for your wards and your plays. If you go balls deep and your team don't back you up, guess what. Its your fault you went ball deep. if you get ganked and you didn't have wards up, guess what. its your fault. 

And to be perfectly honest. If you don't like what someone is saying. Mute them. 

Now all you have to worry about is trolls and afks. There the real problem. Not ragers
